biotools.summary: In this web server we provide public access for two new computational methods for selenoprotein identification and analysis. This tool replaces its predecessor SECISearch as a tool for prediction of eukaryotic SECIS elements and becomes a new method for selenoprotein gene detection that predicts selenoprotein sequences encoded upstream of SECIS elements. It is able to both identify known selenoproteins and predict new selenoproteins.

bioschemas.name: SECISearch3  Seblastian
